title: IAF AND EAC CUP RACES HELD AT ROYAL CALCUTTA TURF CLUB
text:
Press Release:Press Information Bureau

                              Ministry of Defence

                                    IAF AND EAC CUP RACES HELD AT ROYAL CALCUTTA TURF CLUB

                              Posted On:
                25 FEB 2026 7:39PM by PIB Delhi

The prestigious Indian Air Force (IAF) Cup and Eastern Air Command (EAC) Cup races were conducted with grandeur at the historic Royal Calcutta Turf Club (RCTC) on 25 February 2026. These annual fixtures, instituted in 1996, commemorate the strong association between the Indian Air Force and the RCTC.

The RCTC, founded in 1847 and bestowed the title 'Royal' in 1912, remains one of the most prestigious horse racing organizations in the country. Since then it continues to host the IAF and EAC Cup races as a tribute to the rich heritage and contributions of the Indian Air Force.

Air Chief Marshal AP Singh, Chief of the Air Staff, graced the occasion as the Chief Guest and distributed the prizes along with Air Marshal IS Walia, Air Officer Commanding-in-Chief, Eastern Air Command. This year the winner of the IAF cup was Antony Raj S. On his horse Abhicandra owned by Mr Vikram Bachhawat. While the EAC cup was lifted by MS Deora on his charger Laguna Seca owned by  M/s Caimhill stud farms Pvt td & M/s Sarainaga Racing Pvt Ltd.

Chief of the Air Staff lauded the event as a significant milestone in fostering camaraderie and strengthening the bond between the defence forces and the community as a whole The event saw enthusiastic participation and was attended by senior officers from the Army, Navy, IAF as well as Coast Guard, underscoring the unity among India's defence forces. An enthralling performance by the Indian Air Force Band, added to the splendour of the day captivating the audience with its harmonious renditions, embodying the spirit and pride of the Air Force.
